entry.tran: 清晰的;清楚的;容易识别的
entry.def: Something that is clear-cut is easy to recognize and quite distinct.

example.ex: This was a clear-cut case of the original land owner being in the right...
example.tran: 这个案例中明显是原土地所有人有理。

example.ex: The issue is not so clear cut.
example.tran: 这个问题不是那么清楚。

means.word_mean: 1. clearly or sharply defined to the mind;

sentences.sentence: "Claudius was the first to invade Britain with distinct...intentions of conquest"

means.word_mean: 2. having had all the trees removed at one time;
3. clear and distinct to the senses; easily perceptible;

sentences.sentence: "the letter brought back a clear image of his grandfather"
